message.content:
1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should display a collection of texture images, each accompanied by a brief title and description. The layout will be a responsive grid that adjusts to the screen size, presenting textures in a visually appealing and accessible manner. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **TextureCard** (Standalone): A card-like component that displays a texture image, its title, and a short description. - **TextureGrid** (Takes children): A grid container that organizes multiple TextureCard components in a responsive layout. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html

Explore Textures

``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **TextureCard**: ```html

{texture_title}

{texture_description}

``` - **TextureGrid**: ```html
{children}
```

1) What should the UI look like? The UI for a Chart Control should display a chart and include interactive elements such as buttons or dropdowns to adjust the view of the chart (e.g., changing the chart type or the data displayed). This UI can consist of a chart area, a set of control buttons like 'Bar', 'Line', 'Pie' to change the chart type, and possibly a dropdown to select different data sets. 2) What are the individual components that make up the UI? - **ChartArea**: Standalone component where the chart itself is displayed. - **ControlBar**: Standalone component that contains interactive elements such as buttons or dropdowns to manipulate the chart. 3) What does the HTML for the UI look like? ```html
``` 4) What is the HTML for each component? - **ChartArea**: ```html

Chart content goes here.

``` - **ControlBar**: ```html
```

1) **What should the UI look like?** - The UI should present a clean and organized display of various sponsorship opportunities. Each opportunity should be clearly separated, possibly in card format, displaying key information such as the title of the sponsorship, benefits, and a call-to-action button for more details or to apply. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **SponsorshipCard**: A standalone component. It displays information about a single sponsorship opportunity and includes a button for further actions. - **Button**: A standalone component. It represents a reusable button used for actions like learning more or applying for the sponsorship. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html

Sponsorship Opportunities

``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **SponsorshipCard**: ```html

{sponsorship_title}

{benefits_summary}

``` - **Button**: ```html ```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should feature a list of payment method options (e.g., Credit Card, PayPal, Bank Transfer). Each option would typically have an icon representing the payment method, a label describing it, and potentially a radio button to select the method. The selection should be obvious and easy to navigate, especially on mobile devices. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **PaymentOptionsContainer (Standalone)**: This component will act as a container for all the payment options. - **PaymentOption (Children)**: This component represents a single payment method. It can include a radio input for selection and a label showing the payment method details. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **PaymentOptionsContainer**: ```html
{children}
``` - **PaymentOption**: ```html
{children}
```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should include a responsive footer section that is typically found at the bottom of a webpage. It should contain three segments: contact information, quick links, and social media links. Each segment should be clearly labeled and easy to navigate. On mobile devices, the segments should stack vertically, while on larger screens, they should be displayed in a horizontal layout. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **ContactInfo** (Standalone): Displays business contact details like phone number, email, and address. - **QuickLinks** (Standalone): Shows links to important pages such as Home, About Us, Services, etc. - **SocialMediaLinks** (Standalone): Displays icons or textual links to social media profiles. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **ContactInfo**: ```html

Contact Us

{phoneNumber}

{emailAddress}

{postalAddress}

``` - **QuickLinks**: ```html

Quick Links

  • Home
  • About Us
  • Services
  • Contact
``` - **SocialMediaLinks**: ```html

Follow Us

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Instagram
```

prompt: Rotating display of images or content, often used for showcasing products or features

message.content:
1) What should the UI look like? - The UI should be a carousel layout that rotates through different items (images or content) automatically or by user navigation. It will feature a main display area where the current item is visible, and optional navigation arrows on the sides to cycle through the items manually. There could also be a series of indicators (dots or bars) showing the active item and providing a means to jump to a specific item in the sequence. 2) What are the individual components that make up the UI? - **CarouselContainer** (Standalone): The main wrapper that holds the entire carousel setup including the navigational elements and the display area. - **CarouselItem** (Takes children): Represents a single item in the carousel, such as an image or a block of text. - **CarouselNavigation** (Standalone): Contains navigation buttons or icons to move through the carousel items. 3) What does the HTML for the UI look like? ```html
{content_one}
{content_two}
{content_three}
``` 4) What is the HTML for each component? - **CarouselContainer**: ```html
{children}
``` - **CarouselItem**: ```html
{children}
``` - **CarouselNavigation**: ```html
```

1) What should the UI look like? The UI for the Navbar/Mega Menu should display a horizontal list of main navigation items, which upon hovering or clicking (adjustable for touch devices), reveal large dropdown panels containing structured groups of options. This should include links, possible subsections, and potentially a short descriptive text or images if space allows. This should be responsive, visually appealing, and accessible. 2) What are the individual components that make up the UI? - **Navbar**: Standalone component, serves as the container for the navigation items. - **NavItem**: Standalone component, represents each navigation item that can trigger the mega menu. - **MegaMenu**: Takes children, represents the dropdown menu panel that appears upon interaction with a NavItem. 3) What does the HTML for the UI look like? ```html
Home
Products
Services
About Us
Contact
``` 4) What is the HTML for each component? **Navbar**: ```html
{children}
``` **NavItem**: ```html
{children}
``` **MegaMenu**: ```html

Category 1

  • Sub-item 1
  • Sub-item 2
  • Sub-item 3

Category 2

  • Sub-item 1
  • Sub-item 2

Category 3

  • Sub-item 1
  • Sub-item 2
  • Sub-item 3
```

1) What should the UI look like? - The UI should display a table control designed for displaying rows of data. It will include elements like a header row that labels each column, and multiple rows that represent data entries. The table should be clear and easy to read, making it optimal for both desktop and mobile views. 2) What are the individual components that make up the UI? - **TableContainer**: A standalone component that encapsulates the entire table. - **TableHeader**: A standalone component that displays the column names. - **TableRow**: A component that takes children. It represents a single row in the table displaying data. 3) What does the HTML for the UI look like? ```html
``` 4) What is the HTML for each component? - **TableContainer**: ```html
{children}
``` - **TableHeader**: ```html {header_label} ``` - **TableRow**: ```html {children} ``` Each `TableRow` would be duplicated for each data entry in the table, and each cell within a `TableRow` will contain the data specific to the column as described in `TableHeader`.

1) What should the UI look like? The UI should present a central main content area optimized for readability and interaction. This area would typically be designed to maximize focus on the content it displays, whether that be text, images, or mixed media. It should be well-padded, centered, and responsive to screen sizes, adjusting gracefully from mobile to desktop displays. 2) What are the individual components that make up the UI? - **MainContainer** (standalone): This is the wrapper component for the main content area. It provides padding and centers the content within. - **Content** (takes children): This component actually holds the content. It may contain text, images, or other HTML elements. 3) What does the HTML for the UI look like? Insert `` in the HTML where you want the component to be inserted. ```html
``` 4) What is the HTML for each component? - MainContainer: ```html
{children}
``` - Content: ```html
{children}
```

prompt: Sorting options for posts by top, new, and hot

message.content:
1) **What should the UI look like?** - The UI should display a sorting section with three buttons or links labeled "Top", "New", and "Hot". These buttons should be easily accessible and clearly visible, allowing users to select their desired sorting method for viewing posts. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **SortingOptions** (Standalone): A component containing the sorting controls. - **SortButton** (Stand-alone): A reusable button component for each sorting option. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **SortingOptions**: ```html
Top New Hot
``` - **SortButton**: ```html ```
